ARABIC: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا۟ وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا۟ وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor mean, but take a stance mid way between the two;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Who are neither prodigal nor miserly in their spending but follow a middle path;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly but keep the golden mean between the two (extremes):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who in their spending are neither extravagant nor stingy but maintain moderation,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And those who, when spending, neither exceed the limits nor act miserly, and stay in moderation between the two.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor stingy, but are in a just balance between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they who when they spend, are neither extravagant nor parsimonious, and (keep) between these the just mean.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: who, when they expend, are neither prodigal nor parsimonious, but between that is a just stand;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor grudging; and there is ever a firm station between the two;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They are those who are neither extravagant nor niggardly, but keep a balance between the two;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And those who when they expend, are neither extravagant nor sparing, and it is a medium in-between.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Those who are neither wasteful nor tightfisted when spending, but balanced between these [two extremes].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Those who, when they spend, are not extravagant and not niggardly, but hold a just (balance) between those (extremes);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And those, who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor niggardly, but hold a medium (way) between those (extremes).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: who when they spend are neither wasteful nor miserly, between that is a just stand,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And those who, when they spend, are neither wasteful nor stingy, but choose a middle course between that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:67] And who, when they expend, upon their dependants, are neither prodigal nor parsimonious (read yaqturū or yuqtirū); but between such, prodigality and parsimony, lies — [between the two] their expenditure [is in] — moderation;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah then mentioned their spending, saying: (And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal) they are not prodigal with regard to transgression (nor grudging) they do not withhold that which is right; (and there is ever a firm station) a middle ground (between the two) between prodigality and being miserly;
